message: I have thoughts of doing this: http://pastebin.com/UKYCcSLE - I'm lazy and don't want to type options = dict() in all my views.  It this ok or am I missing something. I know calling locals() in render_to_response exposes everything in your template.

I would be explicit. I find using the dict() constructor saves me from typing to many "'s. So my render looks like this: render_to_response(template, dict(foo=foo,bar=bar),context_instance=...) where foo and bar are objects defined in my view
Only works for string based key, but for a template context that is all you need.
